snippet: Microsoft is taking an unusual approach to tackling a shortage of computer science graduates — one of the most serious issues facing the technology industry, and a broader challenge for the nation’s economy.
abstract: Microsoft, taking an unusual approach to tackling shortage of computer science graduates, is dispatching 110 engineers from high-tech companies to teach high school classes; shortage is one of the most serious issues facing the technology industry, and a broader challenge for nation’s economy.
